annotation: The difference between bieng "short in height" (a) and "short in length" (b) has not been found

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: both of object and of person
1. Short (as a rope or line that has been drawn in, a leg, one's tongue)
Means 'short', without any further specification of height or length acceptation of this word
Low in status and short in elevation (Rmn)
Expect initial [p] if cognate with Bunun. -EG
Expect initial [p] if cognate with Bunun. -EG
lacking in length (does not modify height)
lacking in length (does not modify height)
Used as a general term for short without any distinction between height and length features of objects
